description: Dive into "Cologne's Hidden Beach Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Cologne's Hidden Beach Escapes

places.generalDescription: Blackfoot Beach is a man-made beach situated by the picturesque Fuhlinger Lake in the northern part of Cologne. It offers a variety of activities for both relaxation and adventure seekers. Visitors can enjoy sunbathing, swimming, and various water sports such as stand-up paddleboarding, beach volleyball, archery, canoeing, and diving. Additionally, there is a treetop rope course located near the water for those seeking an adrenaline rush.

sources.snippet: In the north of the city, at F√ºhlinger See lake, Blackfoot Beach has chilled spots for peace-loving sun worshippers as well as plenty of outdoor action for people who can‚Äôt keep their feet still in the sand for long!. There‚Äôs a range of sports activities to try out, including stand-up paddleboarding, beach volleyball, archery, canoeing, diving and a high ropes course right next to the water. This Cologne beach club has cabanas to relax in too, as well as white sand and a wide range of food options.
sources.shortName: Four truly fabulous beach clubs in Cologne

sources.snippet: The beach section on the Lake is lovely, with its nice white sandy area. To enter, adults need to pay an entry fee of ¬£6, which can be done online by registering and showing your QR code at the entrance. Additionally, you have the option to book in advance and rent beach chairs, cabanas, and even 'huts' for a group.

F√ºhlingen Wei√üer Sandstrand, Palmen, gem√ºtliche Pavillons und Liegest√ºhle sorgen f√ºr Urlaubsstimmung am F√ºhlinger See. Hier seid ihr richtig, wenn ihr nicht nur faul in der Sonne liegen wollt: Kanus, Stand-Up-Paddleboards sowie ein Hochseilgarten bieten reichlich Abwechselung.
sources.shortName: Sch√∂ne Beachclubs und Strandbars in K√∂ln

places.name: Blackfoot Beach

reviews.text: Great action and challenging routes! It's a lot of fun, and there's something for all age groups. We've organized both our son's and daughter's birthday parties here, and the kids had a fantastic time on each occasion. There's a thorough briefing at the beginning, and the staff is always helpful. It's definitely worth it!

Nice white sandy beach section on the Lake. Entry fee is ¬£6 for an adult. (You need to register and pay online and show your QR code at the entrance.)  You can also book in advance and rent beach chairs, cabanas and even 'huts' for a group with gas grilling facilities that come with tables and plenty of chairs. There is one beach bar with some small food options like fries and wurst, would be a nice addition to have one more food/bar as lines can be long and we are not even in full summer season yet. All in all a really nice spot to spend time at and easily accessible by bike from downtown Cologne!

On June 29th, my spouse and I visited Black Foot. The reservation email clearly stated that no outside food was allowed, so we followed the instructions and did not bring any. However, our food order was still not ready more than two hours later, and we noticed our order was not even listed on the display screen.

Despite informing the staff, we received little assistance, and getting a refund proved unnecessarily difficult. This was a highly disappointing experience due to poor organization and customer service.

If you are planning to visit Black Foot, I strongly recommend bringing your own food. Otherwise, you risk going hungry - and losing your money.

places.generalDescription: F√ºhlinger See, located just outside Cologne, is a popular destination known for its picturesque lakes and a variety of water activities. The man-made beach offers a refreshing escape from city life and features amenities such as comfortable daybeds at the beach bar where visitors can relax under palm trees. Accessible by public transportation or bike, the area also hosts the well-known Summerjam Festival.

sources.snippet: Der F√ºhlinger See liegt ein bisschen au√üerhalb, ist aber easy mit der Linie 15 oder der S-Bahn zu erreichen. Und wer keine Lust auf Bahnfahren hat, schwingt sich einfach aufs Rad und f√§hrt Richtung Norden. Festival-Fans kennen den Weg sowieso schon, da der See mit dem Summerjam eines der bekanntesten Festivals Deutschlands hostet.
sources.shortName: 11 Orte in K√∂ln, an denen ihr euch f√ºhlt wie im Urlaub

sources.snippet: Let's start with the most popular lake in Cologne, which is actually part of the city. In the north of the city we find the winding F√ºhlinger See. All around, there are small bays and hidden corners where you can relax all to yourself.
sources.shortName: The 5 best swimming lakes in and around Cologne

sources.snippet: The Lake ‚ÄúF√ºhlinger See‚Äù in Cologne is known for its lido ("Black Foot Beach") and as an event location, for example for the annual "Summerjam Festival". It also has a high ropes course for all adventure seekers.

places.name: F√ºhlinger See

reviews.text:
An amazing place to spend a weekend with family and friends, able to swim and grill, sunbathing is possible too, toilets in reach and parking lot is available for the cost of 4‚Ç¨ for a day.
Best spot for being in nature with family
Nice place to chill, the water is clean due to the last few years of Corona.
Nice lake overall with lot of amenities and activities. Yet, there is a lot of trash in the beach and even in 2023 you have to pay cash for the parking..

sources.snippet: Sandy beach + excellent water quality = pure vacation feeling. That's what you're guaranteed at this long stretch of water oasis south of Cologne with its glorious white sandy beach. On top of that, there's a restaurant with a beach bar and a large terrace, four-poster beds, sun loungers, beach volleyball and everything else your heart desires.
sources.shortName: The 5 best swimming lakes in and around Cologne

sources.snippet: Very pretty lake with a sandy beach, bar and nice food stalls. However, to get to the main beach there is an entrance fee of 6‚Ç¨ per person (plus 3‚Ç¨ parking), which is definitely excessive. If you can do without the bars, you can easily get to the lake for free by walking to one of the many little bays along the shore.

reviews.text: Visiting on a weekday afternoon-evening is absolute magic! 1 hour bike ride from Central Cologne gets you to this nice lake & swimming area.  It was super peaceful and quiet on a Thursday afternoon. For a 6 euro entrance fee there is a clean changing area, plenty of restrooms, outside showers & white sandy beach. The main restaurant was open, with very delicious food options and the lake is clean and refreshing! We will be back!

Probably the most famous and largest swimming lake in the area. Conveniently located and with plenty of space, it's a popular choice.
The water quality is okay, but there are a few nicer options around.
The best thing is that the lake is huge, and there are plenty of spots you can swim - you don't have to go to the beach part.

Nice place to spend time at the water. A little bit laud as people bring their music with them. At the bar where they serve burger work new people so you have to wait for your food. Also the burgers were good but not prepared how they should be, must work for the recipe. The beach is quite clean but you have to be careful for the birds poo. There is a toilet and changing rooms and showers. Everything nice but an entrance ticket a little too expensive for going every day. Big parking, 3 euro for a single entrance

sources.snippet: Another popular bathing spot just outside Cologne is the lake ‚ÄúOtto-Maigler-See‚Äù in H√ºrth. It is known for its fine sandy beach and good water quality.

reviews.text: Really nice place! Most conveniently accessible by car‚Ä¶ hence, not as crowded with other places. Nice place to swim and hangout by the beach

Beautiful and peaceful place. The lake is a fair size with some wildlife. There are gravel and grass footpaths  all around the lake. You can either walk on them or ride them. On one side there is a lovely beach, which costs ‚Ç¨5 for a whole day. You can swim in the lake or kayak on it without any restrictions, just obviously be sensible and respectful.
Overall, a gorgeous place to go and charge your batteries.

Great place... went there for a wedding party at the Beach Club. Lovely atmosphere when the weather is good and the sun is shining.

Very friendly staff... especially like the cocktail mixer (large selection of cocktails).

places.generalDescription: SonnenscheinEtage, also known as Sunshine Floor, is a beach club located in the heart of the city. It offers a high-altitude beach atmosphere on the top floor of a 14-story parking structure. The rooftop features bamboo matting to shield visitors from the city bustle and provides wicker seats, deck chairs, Europallet seating, and driftwood seating. Visitors can enjoy a Caribbean vibe with views of the city from sun loungers on 30 tons of fine gravel.

sources.snippet: Cologne‚Äôs SonnenscheinEtage takes the beach club concept to new heights ‚Äì literally!. Right in the middle of the city, at this beach bar you go up (fourteen floors to be precise) to wind down and enjoy the holiday vibes on the roof of a multi-storey car park. With bamboo fencing to keep the urban hustle and bustle out, this really is a fantastic place to chill to some tunes among the palm trees.
sources.shortName: Four truly fabulous beach clubs in Cologne

sources.snippet: Innenstadt An welchem Strand kann man schon das Auto unter dem Liegestuhl parken?. In der SonnenscheinEtage ‚Äì dem Beachclub auf der obersten Etage des Kaufhof-Parkhauses. Hier genie√üt ihr einen tollen Blick √ºber die D√§cher K√∂lns ‚Äì nat√ºrlich mit ‚ÄûAussich op d‚Äôr Dom‚Äú.
sources.shortName: Sch√∂ne Beachclubs und Strandbars in K√∂ln

sources.snippet: Etage des Kaufhof-Parkhauses der Sonne tats√§chlich ziemlich nah. Unter Palmen und auf feinstem Kies l√§sst es sich ganz wunderbar entspannen. Man k√∂nnte meinen, man w√§re in einer Beachbar in der S√ºdsee gelandet ‚Äì w√§re da nicht dieser atemberaubende Domblick.
sources.shortName: 11 Orte in K√∂ln, an denen ihr euch f√ºhlt wie im Urlaub

places.name: SonnenscheinEtage ‚Äì K√∂lns h√∂chster Stadtstrand

reviews.text: Nice place to chill with friends and grab drinks while enjoying a rooftop view of the city. Plenty of shade available under the sunbrellas as well. Best to go early (6 pm-ish), it gets packed after 8 pm, and the sunchairs are mostly taken by then. Chill music in the background, gives a cool atmosphere- while it allows you to still have proper conversations :) Good drink options of beers, wines and cocktails. A bit tricky to find at first - once inside the 'B' PARKING LOT of the Kaufhof - take the elevator on the left - that's the only one that goes to the rooftop. (14th floor).

Brilliant time on the 14th floor of a car park.
Drinks are great and so are the drinks.
Back again tomorrow.
C U there .
Very nice spot in the city for good drinks in a nice environment in the summer! The prices of the drinks are ok, but you have to pay 5‚Ç¨ for the entrance.

places.address: Galeria Kaufhof Karstadt, 14. Etage (linker Fahrstuhl) / 14th floor (left elevator, An St. Agatha 19-25/Parkhaus B, 50667 K√∂ln, Germany

sources.snippet: Prefer to pack a picnic basket and head for a Cologne beach that isn‚Äôt a club?. That‚Äôs what you‚Äôll find at Rodenkirchen Riviera, the city‚Äôs very own c√¥te d‚Äôazur. The most enjoyable way to get there is to cycle south from the city, along the right bank of the Rhine.
sources.shortName: Four truly fabulous beach clubs in Cologne

reviews.text: A very nice riverfront with people enjoying the weather everywhere you will love it
Dip yer toes in the rhine, pals! (Don't forget sun screen on the Costa del Solz)

Lovly place to walk on a weekend/ weekday when free . The place has this holiday feeling when you got not enough time to fly for a holiday
‚ù§Ô∏è

places.generalDescription: Bleibtreusee is a stunning forest lake located in the Cologne region, surrounded by picturesque hills. It is the largest of the Ville lakes and offers a range of activities for visitors. The clear waters are perfect for swimming and surfing, with a small beach area ideal for sunbathing and volleyball. Boats can be hired to explore the tranquil lake, while water skiing facilities provide high-speed excitement just a few kilometers away.

sources.snippet: A bathing beach paradise with water ski and wakeboard facilities lies south of our cathedral city. Lake Bleibtreusee is small but beautiful and still has plenty of space for splashing around despite the water ski and wakeboard tracks. If you don't dare to use the fast boards, you can also hire a stand-up paddleboard here, drift along at a leisurely pace and take a short break on the bathing island.
sources.shortName: The 5 best swimming lakes in and around Cologne

places.name: Bleibtreusee

reviews.text: Incredibly beautiful place to go swimming. It would probably be nicer if there wasn't a watersports park at the swimming beach but still great. Very busy in the evenings on hot days.
Very good place to swim. There is big enough auto lot . Parking price is affordable.  Lake is clean and nice
Nice and small lake . And there is also a small beach for FKK , left side from parking lot. Which u have to Pay, 2 ‚Ç¨/one hour. One day 8‚Ç¨

places.generalDescription: Naherholungsanlage Rotter See is a delightful recreational area that offers a perfect escape for families and nature lovers alike. Nestled around a picturesque lake, it features scenic walking paths, inviting grassy spots for picnics, and a sandy beach ideal for sunbathing or paddleboarding. While motorboats and jet skis are prohibited to protect the local wildlife‚Äîprimarily ducks‚Äîthe tranquil waters remain clear, although they can get stirred up during busy days.
places.name: Naherholungsanlage Rotter See

reviews.text:
Great lake for recreation, sunbathing, SUP/paddleboarding. Motorboats and jetskies are not allowed due to wildlife (ducks mostly)
There is a sand beach with lifeguards. With good weather it is getting more crowded. That also means that the water is getting more stirred up (floating seaweed, algae). Otherwise however the water is clear!
No showers or changing rooms and only mobile toilets.
Parking is available, but in summer it is always overcrowded. Rather opt for a bus.
During the summer season at least 1 truck is parking at the beach with icecream and cold drinks (no coffee though üò¢)
There is also a hiking/cycling route around the lake. That I can recommend to take the whole year. Beautiful place!
Lovely spot for a swim. It would be ideal if there were toilets, too.
Nice lake , the big FREE parking lot AND TOILETS. On the weekend,  baywatch guard is there . Beach itself is not very clean, but it's only one in 50km radius that's why it's very crowded.
